f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The topic of trust in a decentralized system, such as Cardano, can be potentially important. However, the very unspecific way in which the challenge is defined does not explicitly address the strategic goals of Fund8 (grow & develop contributors, make Cardano into an open-source project, grow the dev and app ecosystem).

To make this proposal stronger, I'd suggest to consider the following ideas:
1) provide an overview of specific trust-related problems that recently created major damages or lost opportunities for the community.
2) provide a list of use cases, where lack of trust framework block adoption, onboarding of contributors or development of apps.

I have made the following deductions:
- 2 points because this initiative does not support any of the strategic goals of Fund 8.
- 1 point for the lack of a clear analysis of the problem, use cases, and their impact.
My rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q1:
In general the catalyst community consists of people passionate about decentralized systems, so should have the necessary skills to address the challenge.

At the same time, because this proposal is vary loosely defined, it is hard to judge which types of skills and resources are necessary to make progress.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of clear problem definition and use cases.
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal defines the number of standards that can be audited as the sole progress metric.

While it can be used to track some activity in the community, it is completely insufficient to track the progress in solving the underlying problems (not use-case specific) in the community. The proposal could be made stronger if considered some of the following ideas/metrics:
1) define a specific list of target use cases, and for them develop use-case specific metrics (eCommerce, decentralized exchanges, etc.)
2) find metrics tracking the impact on the Fund 8 objective (contributors, apps, developers, etc.)
3) compare the solutions with other solutions of competitors in the market (user satisfaction, adoption, etc.)
4) track the impact of the solutions on the growth of the Cardano community (the number of users, etc.)

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for only one and ambiguos metric to track activity.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 2.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think I am competent to assess this proposal for a challenge setting as I have been active in project Catalyst since fund 4 and I have experience analyzing business requirements from over 5 years of delivering software solutions for small business and corporations as well.
The purpose of the “Building a Trust Framework” challenge setting is to incentivize people to come up with proposals that would help “establish standards for the industry that can be audited and accredited”. This sounds like a good idea, but the proposer has given very few details about what would fit here concretely. I’m also not entirely sure how much the industry standards can be set by people in the Catalyst Community yet (this is something we see being done by big actors such as IOG), because you need a lot of experience and influence, I think, to be able to do this.
In its current form, I disagree that this challenge proposal aligns with Catalyst’s current goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has not provided any concrete guidelines for what type of ideas they expect to see in this proposal. Furthermore, as I stated before, I’m not sure the Catalyst Community has the necessary experience yet to be able to set industry standards. That’s quite a big task for freelancers and (mostly) beginners.
With so little guidance on what is expected here, I disagree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
No metrics for success have been provided, unfortunately (I do not think the statement “Standards that can be Audited and achieve Accreditation” qualifies). According to the proposer, success looks like “Development of Practices and Standards that are aligned with the regulatory environment for Financial Institutions.”, but this is again extremely vague. Which Financial Institutions? Crypto is global. 
I completely disagree that the success of this challenge can be verified with so little information as we have here now.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge setting is a welcome idea and a challenge which the community will embrace accordingly considering the potential backlash from legacy systems and regulations, this setting will prepare the ecosystem for a potential regulatory compliance that is coming to the space. In addition, the challenge setting will definitely create an enabling environment that endgers trust and security for the legacy financial institutions to be easily onboarded on the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: I am very confident that the community and stakeholders within the ecosystem have more than enough skill, capacity and experience to propose compelling and innovative projects to resolve this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposed success metric and end result of the challenge is adequate and reliable to assess and monitor the success of this challenge if eventually approved.
